greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of log(Pi/2).
reference: G. Boros and V. Moll, Irresistible Integrals: Symbolics, Analysis and Experiments in the Evaluation of Integrals, Cambridge University Press, Cambridge, 2004, Chap. 7.
J. Borwein and P. Borwein, Pi and the AGM, John Wiley & Sons, New York, 1987, Chap. 11.
link: D. Huylebrouck, Similarities in irrationality proofs for Pi, ln2, zeta(2) and zeta(3), Amer. Math. Monthly 108 (2001) 222-231.
J. Sondow, A faster product for pi and a new integral for ln(pi/2), Amer. Math. Monthly 112 (2005), 729-734 and 113 (2006), 670.
formula: Equals Sum_{n>=1} zeta(2*n)/(n*2^(2*n) (cf. Boros & Moll p. 131). - _Jean-François Alcover_, Apr 29 2013
Equals Integral_{-infinity..+infinity} -log(1/2 + i*z)/cosh(Pi*z) dz, where i is the imaginary unit. - _Peter Luschny_, Apr 08 2018
results.author: _Jonathan Sondow_ and _Robert G. Wilson v_, May 18 2004
